isis.stitle: TSI 97-08-08 - Bunk Blower Motor Feed Relocated to Ignition Side of Switch

subjectgroup.subject: Bunk Blower Motor Feed Relocated to Ignition Side of Switch

geninfo.para: Effective April 17, 1997, the bunk blower motor feed wire on 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 Conventional Models will be relocated from the accessory side of the key switch to the ignition side of the key switch. This engineering design change is being implemented to prevent low or discharged batteries when the key switch is left in the accessory position with the blowers on.
With the introduction of the new Blend-Air HVAC system, all 9000 Models will have the bunk blower motor feed relocated to the ignition side of the key switch.

note.para: To reduce electrical load during engine start-up (cranking), the blower motors should be turned off.
